page.title: 07Faldingworth Chapel
page.content: Faldingworth{chapel}is a Methodist {chapel.} It is quite small, with a congregation on Sundays of about 7 in the morning and 14 in the evening. It is built of red brick with a slate roof, but no spire. All around the walls are the initials of the men who helped build the{chapel.} The foundations were laid and the{chapel completed in 1897. It has an organ, a pulpit and a communion rail. There are several rooms including a kitchen, a vestry and a schoolroom. The{chapel}was built to replace an earlier version. It was a very small chapel, with no spire, schoolroom or stained glass windows. It was built in approximately 1780 and cost between Â£700 and Â£800. The{chapel}organ was donated by Mr. Doughty in loving memory of his wife, in 1927.
